questions.text: Severe depression and feeling of misery without any reason is seen in : (*)
The term “involutional melancholia” was used by kraeplein to describe? (**)
Which of the following fixed dose combination has been proven to be most effective in treatment of acute bipolar depression?

A patient diagnosed with first episode major depressive disorder was started on medication, sertraline 50 mg once daily. The patient returns to psychiatrist on 7th day of treatment with complaints of no improvement in symptoms. What is the next step to be taken by psychiatrist? (*)

options.label: C
options.text: Change antidepressant to one with different mechanism of action

options.label: D
options.text: Reassure the patient and make no changes in treatment

questions.correct_answer: D. Reassure the patient and make no changes in treatment

questions.text: A 45-year-old man with schizoaffective disorder is on lithium, sertraline, lorazepam, and olanzapine. He develops low sodium levels and complains of extreme lethargy. The most likely offending agent is
Most peculiar alteration in sleep neurophysiology in depression is?

options.label: A
options.text: Nocturnal awakenings and early morning awakening

options.label: C
options.text: Increase in total duration of REM sleep

questions.text: All of the following antipsychotics are FDA approved in treatment of acute mania except? (***)
Copycat suicide is seen at age of: (*)
The technique of “psychological Autopsy” is useful in studying the causation of :
Which of the following is not true regarding post partum psychiatric disorders?

options.label: A
options.text: Post partum psychosis, patient has depressed mood

options.label: B
options.text: There is risk of suicide in women having post partum depression

options.label: C
options.text: ECT is safe modality of treatment in lactating women

options.label: D
options.text: Post partum psychosis, patient has poor response to treatment

questions.correct_answer: D. Post partum psychosis, patient has poor response to treatment

questions.text: Paradoxical suicide is seen in: (AIIMS MAY 19)

options.label: A
options.text: Suicide after taking low dose of drug

options.label: B
options.text: Suicide occurring at the time when the patient starts to recover

questions.correct_answer: B. Suicide occurring at the time when the patient starts to recover

questions.text: A 60-years-old man whose wife died 3 months back now starts to believe that his intestines have rotten away and that he is responsible for the death of his wife and should be sent to prison. The most likely diagnosis is:
What does Ultra Rapid cycling in Bipolar Mood disorder means?
questions.correct_answer: D. More than 4 episodes per month

questions.text: Which of the following features seen in a 12 y old child suffering from depression is not suggestive of development of bipolar disorder later? (JIPMER MAY 19)
Which of the following is not an indication of use of “ELECTROCONVULSIVE THERAPY” in psychiatry?

options.label: C
options.text: Depression with refusal to take food

questions.text: Mr. X was treated by a doctor for his sad mood and suicidal ideas and while doing so therapist is asking for his negative thoughts, worthlessness and tries to correct it. Which type of psychotherapy is she giving? (NIMHANS 19)
Which of the following is correctly matched adequate antidepressant dose? (JIPMER DEC 19)
Which of the following statement is true about “cyclothymia”? (NIMHANS OCT 19)

options.label: A
options.text: Should definitely have an episode of severe depression

options.label: C
options.text: Should definitely have an episode of mania

options.label: D
options.text: Should have major periods of hypomania

questions.correct_answer: B. Minimum duration to diagnose is 2yrs

questions.text: A 28-year-old man comes to the physician complaining that he is "just not feeling like myself." This feeling began soon after his younger brother passed away from cancer 3 months ago. The patient is no longer interested in work or going out with friends on weekends. He falls asleep relatively easily at night but awakes very early in the morning and is unable to fall back asleep. He admits to feeling "down in the dumps," especially when he first wakes up but says that his mood improves a little during the day. The patient often thinks about ways that he could have spent more time with his brother. He feels guilty about his brother's death being his fault "because I am worthless and could not love him enough." His poor energy and concentration have started to affect his performance at work, and he frequently thinks that he should just quit "because I am bringing everyone down." The patient has been eating less and has lost 3 kgs over the past few weeks. What is this patient's most likely diagnosis?

A patient with a diagnosis of depression was started on Imipramine, the treatment was given for 2 weeks. After that the relatives noticed that the patient developed new symptoms like, being excessively cheerful, increased excitement, wearing of colourful clothes and increased talking. What is the most appropriate next step in treatment? (NEET 2020)

options.label: D
options.text: Discontinue imipramine and add sodium valproate

questions.correct_answer: D. Discontinue imipramine and add sodium valproate

questions.text: A 34 year old housewife reports a three month history of feeling low, lack of interest in activities, lethargy, multiple body-aches, ideas of worthlessness, decreased appetite and disturbed sleep with early morning awakening. She is likely to benefit form

A middle aged man presented with pain in back, lack of interest in recreational activities, low mood, lethargy, decreased sleep and appetite for two months. There was no history suggestive of delusions or hallucinations. He did not suffer from any chronic medical illness. There was no family history of psychiatric illness. Routine investigations including hemogram, renal function tests, liver function tests electrocardiogram did not reveal any abnormality. This patient should be treated with

A 40 yr old female patient present with history of depressed mood, loss of appetite insomnia and no interest in surroundings for the past 1 yr. These symptoms followed soon after a business loss 1 yr back. Which of the following statements is true regarding the management of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: No treatment is necessary as it is due to business loss

options.label: B
options.text: SSRI is the most efficacious of the available drugs

options.label: C
options.text: Antidepressant treatment based on the side effect profile of the drugs

questions.correct_answer: C. Antidepressant treatment based on the side effect profile of the drugs

questions.text: A 60 year male is brought by his wife. He thinks that he had committed sins all through his life. He is very much depressed and has considered committing suicide but has not through hot do go about it. He had also attached sessions with a spiritual guru. He is not convinced by his wife that he has leaded a pious life. He does not want to hear anything on the contrary. How will you treat him

A 20 year old man has presented with increased alcohol consumption and sexual indulgence, irritability, lack of sleep, and not feeling fatigued even on prolonged periods of activity. All these changes have been present for 3 weeks. The most likely diagnosis is

A67 year old lady is brought in by her 6 children saying that she has gone senile. Six months after her husband's death she has become more religious, spiritual and gives lot of money in donation. She is occupied in too many activities and sleeps less. She now believes that she has a goal to change the society. She does not like being brought to the hospital and is argumentative on being questioned on her doings. The diagnosis is -

A 42 year old male with a past history of a manic Episode presents with an illness of 1 month duration characterized by depressed mood,anhedonia andprofound psychomotor retardation. The most appropriate management strategy is prescribing a combination of-

MS. B, a 27 year old nurse had decreased interest in talking and painting. She had a breakup relationship with her boy friend. Two months later she lost interest in her hobbies and was convinced that she would not be able to work again. She thought life was not worth living and has consumed 60 tablets of phenobarbitone to end her life, she is most likely suffering from -

A 59 yr old teacher with three decades in public service is depressed that he is going to be retired soon, he was prescribed with antidepressant. On 7th day of the treatment, he comes with the acute retention of urine, the offending drug could be-
A female patient on treatment for depression took a massive dose of amitryptiline for suicide. Which of the following statement regarding her management is wrong?

options.label: B
options.text: Sodium bicarbonate should be administered to treat acidosis

options.label: C
options.text: Atropine sulphate should be administered as an antidote

options.label: D
options.text: Diazepam should be injected to control seizures

questions.correct_answer: C. Atropine sulphate should be administered as an antidote

questions.text: An 85-year-old man is brought to the psychiatrist by his wife. She states that for the last 4 months, since the death of his son, the patient has been unable to sleep, has lost 2.5 kgs, has crying spells, and in the last week has been starting to talk about suicide. She notes that he has numerous other medical problems, including prostatic hypertrophy, hypertension, insulin-dependent diabetes, and a history of myocardial infarction. Whichof the following medications is most appropriate for the treatment of this patient?

Ram has depressed mood for several months. His wife informs you that he tried to kill himself last month when he reported hearing voices that told him to kill himself. He was hospitalized for 21 days and given a diagnosis of a major depressive disorder. When questioned, he reported having "given up'. He also has a 10-year history of alcoholism. Which of the following would pose the greatest risk for future completed suicide?

A 41 year old woman presented with a history of aches and pains all over the body and generalized weakness for four years. She cannot sleep because of the illness and has lost her appetite as well. She has lack of interest in work and doesn't like to meet friends and relatives. She denies feelings of sadness. Her most likely diagnosis is –
A patient comes in stupor condition, patient's parents give history of being continually sad and suicidal attempts, not eating and sleeping most of the time. The treatment is -

A 50 year old male presents with a 3 year history of irritability, low mood, lack of interest in surroundings and general dis-satisfaction with everything. He has no significant disruption of sleep or appetite. This is likely to be:
All are true about "atypical depression" except:

options.label: D
options.text: More frequent comorbid diagnosis of panic disorder as compared to with typical major depressive disorder

questions.text: A 35-year-old woman delivers a healthy baby boy by Caesarean section. She notes over the next week that she has become irritable and is not sleeping very well. She worries that her child will die and fantasizes that if the child died, she would kill herself as well. She reports not being able to sleep, and has lost weight. Over the course of the following week, she begins to investigate how she might commit suicide and calls a friend to see whether the friend will babysit so that the woman will not be leaving the child alone should this occur. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient suffering from bipolar disorder, getting episodes of mania and depression, because of poor compliance to drugs, psychotherapy of choice?

A 32-year-old woman is brought to the emergency room by the police after she was found standing in the middle of a busy highway, naked, commanding the traffic to stop. In the emergency room she is agitated and restless, with pressured speech and an affect that alternates between euphoric and irritable. Her father is contacted and states that this kind of behavior runs in the family. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 28-year-old woman is diagnosed with bipolar disorder, manic type, when she was hospitalized after becoming psychotic, hypersexual, severely agitated, and unable to sleep. She is started on a medication in the acute phase of her illness. Which of the following medications, recommended for acute use in manic patients, is recommended to be continued on into maintenance therapy?

A 32-year-old man is started on Lithium after being diagnosed with bipolar disorder. His psychiatrist explains the risks and benefits of the drug and tells the patient that the drug can affect several organs in the body and he will need blood tests every 6 months. Which of the following labs should be drawn that often on this patient?

A patient with rapid cycling bipolar disorder was well maintained on carbamazepine, developed skin rash. Psychiatrist tapered the doses, and gradually cross-titrated to oxcarbazepine (newer congener of carbamazepine) but even on oxcarbazepine, the following problem is what the psychiatrist has to be careful about

A 29-year-old woman with a previous diagnosis of bipolar disorder is hospitalized during an acute manic episode. She is elated, sexually provocative, and speaks very fast, jumping from one subject to another. BUN, creatinine, electrolytes, TSH, and an ECG are within normal limits. What other test is necessary before starting the patient on lithium?

A 45-year-old woman has thin legs and arms but a considerable amount of fat deposited on her abdomen, chest, and shoulders. Her skin is thin and atrophic and she has several purple striae on her abdomen. An MRI shows the presence of a pituitary adenoma. The psychiatric disorder most commonly associated with this syndrome is
Features of serotonin syndrome associated with SSRIs, and MOAIs are all except:
The clinical effect of the antidepressant drugs is mainly based on:
questions.correct_answer: A. Change in neurotransmitter receptor sensitivity

questions.text: Pleasure neurotransmitter of human mind?
In India psychiatric disorder in people above 60-year of age is mostly due to:
Which of the following objective signs of depression is shown in figure:
All of the following statements about treatment of depression are false except:

options.label: A
options.text: Cognitive behavioural therapy has been shown to be an effective treatment

options.label: B
options.text: Antidepressant monotherapy is effective 95% of the time

options.label: C
options.text: Antidepressants usually works within 1 to 2 weeks

options.label: D
options.text: Antidepressants medication is not lethal in overdose

questions.correct_answer: A. Cognitive behavioural therapy has been shown to be an effective treatment

questions.text: Which of the following is incorrect concerning the symptoms of PMDD?

options.label: A
options.text: They may include impaired concentration, Insomnia or hypersomnia

options.label: B
options.text: They have been reported to be absent during nonovulatory cycles

options.label: C
options.text: They may be related to how an individual’s brain reacts to normal variations in the serum levels of gonadotropins

options.label: D
options.text: They may be caused by late luteal phase falls in the levels of progesterone and estradiol.

questions.correct_answer: D. They may be caused by late luteal phase falls in the levels of progesterone and estradiol.

questions.text: Which of the following groups is not at increased risk of postpartum psychiatric disorder ?

options.label: B
options.text: Those with a history of psychiatric illness postpartum

options.label: C
options.text: Those with a family history of mood disorders

options.label: D
options.text: Those who experience obstetrical complications during delivery

questions.correct_answer: D. Those who experience obstetrical complications during delivery

questions.text: All of the following may directly cause or mimic depression except:
Which of the following may not have depression as a presenting symptoms.
Risk factor for suicide in depression are all, except:
All are required to diagnose major depression except:
Endocrine disorders associated with depression are all except:
Which of the following is not a feature of mania?
False statement regarding myocardial infarction and depression is:

options.label: A
options.text: Depression is a risk factor for MI

options.label: B
options.text: MI is a risk factor for depression

options.label: C
options.text: SSRI’s can be used post MI for treatment of depression

options.label: D
options.text: Only Cognitive behavioral therapy is used after MI

questions.correct_answer: D. Only Cognitive behavioral therapy is used after MI

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a somatic symptom:
A 48 Years old woman has ingested an unknown amount of Lithium carbonate 2 hours ago. This had been started 3 weeks ago by her psychiatrist. Which of the following is TRUE?

options.label: A
options.text: A lithium level should be taken at 4 hours post ingestion

options.label: B
options.text: The first signs of toxicity are usually gastrointestinal symptoms

options.label: C
options.text: The most common ECG abnormality is QRS prolongation

options.label: D
options.text: Ataxia is a late sign of significant toxicity

questions.correct_answer: B. The first signs of toxicity are usually gastrointestinal symptoms

questions.text: Post stroke depression is more commonly seen with:

options.label: D
options.text: Does not depend on what hemisphere is involved

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman reports that over the past 6 months she has had little appetite, sleeps poorly, and has lost interest in her normal activities. Physical exam is unremarkable. Which of the following is the most likely laboratory finding in this woman?

A 45-year-old female patient reports that over the last 3 months she has lost her appetite and interest in her usual activities, and often feels that life is not worth living. Compared with typical sleep, in this patient the percentage of REM sleep, percentage of delta sleep, and sleep latency, respectively, are most likely to

A 28-year-old man comes in complaining of headaches and a variety of other aches and pains that have been present for the past 6 months. He denies that he is sad or hopeless. After a 4-week trial of antidepressant medication, the patient’s physical complaints have disappeared. The most appropriate diagnosis for this patient is
